text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
MATERIAL CHANGES

IRM 1.2.61.2.11 - DO WI 1-69-1, Authorization to Approve an Internal Management Document (IMD), issued November 19, 2021, added. W&I Division DO WI 1-69-1, Authorization to Approve an Internal Management Document (IMD) was created to support the authorities outlined in Servicewide Delegation Order (SWDO) 1-69, Authorization to Approve an Internal Management Document (IMD), issued May 04, 2021.

Performance Bonuses, Individual and Group Special Act Awards, Managers’ Awards, Bilingual Awards, Honorary Awards, Employee Suggestion Awards, Informal Recognition, and Quality Step Increases, issued November 17, 2021, added. SWDO Order 6-22 issued June 28, 2019 updates Division DO WI 6-6-2 and is now renumbered to DO WI 6-22-1. The title and content of DO WI 6-6-2 align with SWDO 6-22, Delegation Order 6-22 (New), Authority to Approve Monetary and Time-Off Performance Awards, Performance Bonuses, Individual and Group Special Act Awards, Managers’ Awards, Bilingual Awards, Honorary Awards, Employee Suggestion Awards, Informal Recognition, and Quality Step Increases.
Editorial changes made throughout. Renumbered paragraphs within subsections.
ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This IRM incorporates Interim Guidance Memorandum WI-01-1121-7001, Division Delegation Order WI-6-22- 1 (formerly DO WI-6-6-2), Authority to Approve Awards, dated 11/17/2021 and Interim Guidance Memorandum WI-01-1121-7002, Division Delegation Order WI-1-69-1, Authorization to Approve an Internal Management Document (IMD), dated 11/19/2021.

) This IRM contains delegation orders (DO) for the Wage and Investment Division. Distribution of this IRM includes all persons with a need for any of authorities or information in this section. All approved W&I Division Orders are listed in numerical order. Rescinded Division Delegation Orders W&I are retained in this IRM for documentation and audit purposes and current delegation orders. (

) Wage and Investment division DOs are issued only at the operating (Headquarters) level. Direct any questions regarding current division DOs, including revisions or issuance of new division DOs, to the W&I Internal agement Document (IMD) Team at wi.irms@irs.gov (
) Information on Servicewide Delegations of Authority is found in IRM
, vicewide Delegation of Authorities. Furthermore, additional information on delegation order process is found in IRM
, Delegation Orders. (

) Authority is delegated directly to the lowest level expected to take ﬁnal Doing so eliminates the need to issue redelegations of authority to heads office. Delegating authority to the lowest level for action means that: Every tervening supervisory position above the lowest level, including the Commissioner, has the same authority. (
) Management levels are arranged from the lowest level to the highest level. This IRM will use the general management level terms and their deﬁnitions as follows:
Management levels are arranged from the lowest level to the highest level. This IRM will use the general management level terms and their deﬁnitions

Term Deﬁnition Examples First Level Manager A manager who only has Team manager, group or section employees reporting to him/her; manager without subordinate no other managers report to this managers manager Second Level Manager A manager of a ﬁrst level Department, section manager manager with subordinate managers Third Level Manager A manager of a second level Operations manager with subor- manager dinate second level managers, Section level or branch level managers with managers First Level Executive An executive who does not have Field Director, Campus Director, another executive reporting to Area Director him/her Second Level Executive An executive who has a ﬁrst Director with subordinate Execu- level executive reporting to him/ tives (e.g., Director, Customer her Account Services; Director Customer Assistance, Relation- ships and Education; etc.) Third Level Executive An executive who has a second W&I Commissioner/Deputy level executive reporting to him/ Commissioner, IRS her Commissioner/DeputyCommissioner

Division Delegation Order (DO) is rescinded. The Servicewide source of 4-38, To designate Qualiﬁed General Assistance Programs described IRC 51 (d) (6) has been revoked.

Rationale: The authority on which Servicewide Delegation Order 4-38 was Section 51 (d) (6) of the Internal Revenue Code, no longer includes a provision for a General Assistance Program Determination. The organizations conﬁrm that there are no longer any active cases related to the order; therefore, the Division delega- tion order is obsolete.
Signed, Peggy Bogadi, Commissioner, Wage and Investment Division.
